doc.previous: Likewise there are several important theorems related to these operators which generalize the fundamental theorem of calculus to higher dimensions
doc.after: The right hand side is the equation of the plane tangent to the graph of at For a continuously differentiable function of several real variables a point P that is a set of values for the input variables which is viewed as a point in Rn is critical if all of the partial derivatives of the function are zero at P or equivalently if its gradient is zero The critical values are the values of the function at the critical points
